result.execSummary:
The defendant Tarlokh Singh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fraudulent Writings/By Corp. Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.39(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tarlokh Singh

Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tarlokh Singh in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter:  Farah Elahi.    

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Court set restitution at zero ($0). 

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 30 months, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 15 months with credit for 0 days
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 15 months.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 30 months with the following conditions:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Perform 120 hours of community service.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.  If revoked, to be collected by the DOC out of up to 25% of prison wages.
- If revoked Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program but does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

*If revoked, all conditions of probation shall revert to conditions of probation.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Tarlokh Singh in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Punjabi interpreter required.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tarlokh Singh in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense requested a plea and sentencing date.  Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.

Defendant Tarlokh Singh in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing. 

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (01-28-2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Arraignment scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 1/27/15 @ 1 PM
